intro: Ornithogalum demirizianum, commonly known as the Demirizian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
